name: Carrots
properties: Vitamin A from carrot increases the production of mucus in the gastrointestinal tract. Vitamin A may have a protective effect against the development of ulcer disease.

name: Broccoli
properties: Cruciferous vegetables contain sulforaphane, a compound that inhibits H. pylori and heals the ulcer.

name: Chamomile
properties: Chamomile tea to treat intestinal spasms, and inflammation because chamomile extracts have anti-ulcer properties.

name: Cranberries
properties: Cranberry and cranberry extract also may help fight H. pylori and helpful in ulcers.

name: Garlic
properties: Garlic has antimicrobial and antibacterial properties that may help prevent ulcers and heal them quickly.

name: Turmeric
properties: The anti-ulcer activity prevents the damage caused by H. pylori infections. Curcumin protects the stomach lining and helps ulcers heal.

name: Sweet Potato
properties: It’s high in vitamin A, and there’s evidence that this nutrient can help shrink stomach ulcers and may also play a role in preventing them. Other foods with a good dose of vitamin A include spinach, carrots, cantaloupe, and beef liver.

name: Bell Pepper
properties: Rich in vitamin C, has an important role in wound healing and ulcers.
